To unlock Twitter’s potential for growth, tap the attention of the network, rather than trying to bring all attention to a destination @jack
Twitter can be the main Twitter destination, while letting apps & sites do the same, as long as Twitter ads travel with the content. @jack

Twitter can also create and promote its own content and sponsored content in its network - "the network becomes the destination” @jack
Twitter should return to leveraging 3rd party innovation & eyeballs; Twitter is a network not a destination — let 1000 outlets bloom @jack

The Dumbularity is Near -- the point at which software becomes so complex, incompatible & dysfunctional that humans can’t fix it anymore.
The best AI humanity has ever created so far? Stephen Wolfram. But we already have him. Can we shoot for something else now?
“artificial stupidity” (AS) is software that thinks it’s intelligent but isn’t.

RT @firasd: .@novaspivack my favorite synonym The Singularity is “The Nerd Rapture”
Human intelligence took millions (or billions) of years to evolve using the best & fastest massively parallel evolutionary algorithm: Life.
I call it “magical complexity” when people think that when systems get complex “enough” they suddenly become intelligent and conscious.
Kurzweil may be right about growth of computational power, but computation does not equal intelligence.
What is “real AI” - in my opinion it would be equivalent or better than a human brain/mind. We don’t even know what that means yet.
The media makes it seem like Skynet is just around the corner. Not. We can’t even make an agent that can manage my calendar yet!!!
Intelligent Virtual Assistants (IVAs) like Siri, Next IT, Cortana, Google Now, etc. are promising, but they are far from general AI.
Deep Learning aka neural nets has narrow applications. Expert systems & intelligent agents are on pause. Semantic Web is moving slow.
RT @alecperkins: @novaspivack I’m worried about smart software in the hands of dumb people.
Deep learning is not really that new - and it’s not really that smart. Nowhere near human brain. Real AI is 100 years or more away.
I’m calling b.s. on all the hype about AI being super dangerous. I am far more worried about dumb software than smart software.

@DarrenMcKay Not testing virality here, just testing how many people actually see a Tweet vs. “impressions"
Tweet test results 5: The delta between Twitter’s reported impressions & ACTUAL views is increasing as Twitter’s signal/noise gets worse.
Tweet test results 4: Many brands are obsessed with “Impressions” but actually impressions are almost irrelevant today.
Tweet test results 3: value of the “Impressions” on Twitter is dubious (potential views, not actual views). Need a measure of actual views!
Tweet test results 2: The first hour of a Tweet’s life is the best. As it falls below the fold in apps, actual views fall off rapidly.
Tweet test results: Even if small % bothered to fav Tweet vs. % that saw it, it’s still a huge delta. “Impressions” have little value.
